ch.ecma.csta.monitor

Interface MonitoringServices


  • public interface MonitoringServices
    Allows clients to request asynchronous notification of specific events. This interface provides the same functionality as CSTA's Monitoring Services, but does so via Java listeners instead of CSTA service requests.

    This interface provides an add<i>XXX</i>Listener and method for each listener interface in this API. To learn how to use this API's listeners, see Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API .

    Note that not all of the requests and for these services may be supported. In these cases, the request description will state that it is not supported.
    Similarly, not all of the parameters may be supported for a given request, or for any associated events. In these cases, the description of the request (or event) will contain a table of the parameters that are supported.

    Since:
    Communication Manager API 2.1
    Version:
    4.1
    Author:
    Avaya Inc.

    • Method Detail

      • addCallInformationListener

        void addCallInformationListener(CallInformationListener listener)
                         throws CstaException
        Deprecated. Use CallInformationServices
        Not supported.
        Adds a listener to monitor for changes in status of the call information link. To be notified of any status change on the call information link, your application must provide a class that implements CallInformationListener with an implementation of every callback method in the CallInformationListener interface. See the CallInformationListener for the types of events that your application can be notified of. To learn more about using listeners, see Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API.

        If multiple listeners are added, then each listener will be notified of changes to call infromation link status; the corresponding callback will be called on each listener that has been added. If the specified listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.

        Parameters:
        listener - the CallInformationListener implementation to be added
        Throws:
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • removeCallInformationListener

        void removeCallInformationListener(CallInformationListener listener)
                            throws CstaException
        Deprecated. Use CallInformationServices
        Not supported.
        Removes the indicated listener so that it no longer receives notifications of call information link status changes.

        It is possible for a callback to be issued on a listener after it has been removed. If no listeners have been added, then nothing happens when an event occurs. If the specified listener is not one that was previously added or is null, then no exception is thrown and no function is performed.

        Parameters:
        listener - the CallInformationListener implementation to be removed
        Throws:
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • addPhysicalDeviceListener

        void addPhysicalDeviceListener(DeviceID device,
                               PhysicalDeviceListener listener)
                        throws CstaException
        Adds a listener to monitor the specified physical device for events. Events report changes to the components of a physical element of the device (display, lamps and ringer). To learn how to use listeners to monitor events, see Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API.
        Parameters:
        device - the DeviceID to which the PhysicalDeviceListener is applied.
        listener - the PhysicalDeviceListener being applied to the device. If the specified listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
        Throws:
        InvalidDeviceIDException - indicates that there is no station associated with the DeviceID
        ServiceNotSupportedException - indicates that the requested service is not supported
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs
        See Also:
        removePhysicalDeviceListener(ch.ecma.csta.binding.DeviceID, ch.ecma.csta.physical.PhysicalDeviceListener)

      • removePhysicalDeviceListener

        void removePhysicalDeviceListener(DeviceID device,
                                  PhysicalDeviceListener listener)
                           throws CstaException
        Removes a previously specified physical device listener. It is possible for a callback to be issued on a listener after it has been removed.
        Parameters:
        device - the DeviceID whose PhysicalDeviceListener is to be removed.
        listener - the PhysicalDeviceListener being removed from the device. If the specified listener is not one that was previously added, then no exception is thrown and no function is performed. Also, if the specified listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
        Throws:
        InvalidDeviceIDException - indicates that there is no station associated with the DeviceID
        ServiceNotSupportedException - indicates that the requested service is not supported
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs
        See Also:
        addPhysicalDeviceListener(ch.ecma.csta.binding.DeviceID, ch.ecma.csta.physical.PhysicalDeviceListener)

      • addTerminalListener

        void addTerminalListener(DeviceID device,
                         TerminalListener listener)
                  throws CstaException
        Deprecated. as of 3.1, use MonitoringServices.addRegistrationListener instead.
        Adds a TerminalListener for receiving registration events for a specific device. If multiple listeners are added, all listeners will be notified of events. For more information about using listeners see Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API.

        Registration events include:

        • RegisteredEvent
        • RegisterFailedEvent
        • UnregisterEvent

        When your application no longer wants to be notified of registration events for a device, use the removeTerminalListener for each listener that was added.

        Parameters:
        device - the DeviceID to register the listener for
        listener - the TerminalListener implementation to add
        Throws:
        OperationException - if there is no station associated with the DeviceID. Check DeviceID or create DeviceID first.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the listener parameter is null
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • removeTerminalListener

        void removeTerminalListener(DeviceID device,
                            TerminalListener listener)
                     throws CstaException
        Deprecated. as of 3.1, use MonitoringServices.removeRegistrationListener instead.
        Removes the specified TerminalListener from receiving device registration events.
        Parameters:
        device - the DeviceID for which this TerminalListener should be removed
        listener - the TerminalListener to remove
        Throws:
        OperationException - if there is no station associated with the DeviceID. Cannot remove listener. Please check the DeviceID.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the listener parameter is null
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • addMediaControlListener

        void addMediaControlListener(DeviceID device,
                             MediaControlListener listener)
                      throws CstaException
        Adds a MediaControlListener for receiving media control events for a specific device. Used by applications that wish to be notified of media events - usually these are applications that are controlling the media stream.

        If multiple listeners are added, all listeners will be notified of events. For more information about using listeners see Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API.

        Media control events include:

        • MediaStartEvent
        • MediaStopEvent
        Use these events in conjunction with PhysicalDeviceListener's LampModeEvent to determine when media is connected, been shuffled to a different far-end IP address, or has been disconnected. See MediaControlListener for more information about handling media events.
        Parameters:
        device - the DeviceID to register the listener for
        listener - the MediaControlListener to add
        Throws:
        OperationException - if there is no station associated with the DeviceID
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the listener parameter is null
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • removeMediaControlListener

        void removeMediaControlListener(DeviceID device,
                                MediaControlListener listener)
                         throws CstaException
        Removes the specified MediaControlListener from receiving media control events for the specified device.
        Parameters:
        device - the DeviceID whose listener is being removed
        listener - the MediaControlListener to remove
        Throws:
        OperationException - if there is no station associated with the DeviceID
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the listener parameter is null
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • addToneCollectionListener

        void addToneCollectionListener(DeviceID device,
                               ToneCollectionListener listener)
                        throws CstaException
        Adds a listener to monitor the specified device for Tone collection events.

        Java listeners are used to implement the CSTA concept called monitoring.

        When an event occurs, the corresponding listener callback is called. A default callback is provided by ToneCollectionAdapter for each possible event. The default callbacks do nothing. If you want to act upon events, you can customize the events' callbacks for your application in either of the following ways:

        • Provide an implementation of every callback method in the ToneCollectionListener interface with a class that implements ToneCollectionListener.
        • Provide an implementation of a subset of callback methods with a class that extends ToneCollectionAdapter.

        Multiple listeners can be added to a device, then the listeners will be notified of events on that device; the corresponding callback will be called on the listener that has been added.

        Parameters:
        device - the device to which the ToneCollectionListener is added.
        listener - the listener being applied to the device. The listener may be an implementation of the ToneCollectionListener interface or an extension of ToneCollectionAdapter.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterValueException - if device ID or listener is null
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • removeToneCollectionListener

        void removeToneCollectionListener(DeviceID device,
                                  ToneCollectionListener listener)
                           throws CstaException
        Removes a previously specified tone collection listener.

        If no listener is on the device or the specified listener is not one that was previously added or the listener is null, then no exception is thrown and no function is performed.

        Parameters:
        device - the device whose ToneCollectionListener is to be removed
        listener - the listener being removed from the device.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterValueException - if device ID is null
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • addToneDetectionListener

        void addToneDetectionListener(DeviceID device,
                              ToneDetectionListener listener)
                       throws CstaException
        Adds a listener to monitor the specified device for tone detection events.

        Java listeners are used to implement the CSTA concept called monitoring.

        When an event occurs, the corresponding listener callback is called. A default callback is provided by ToneDetectionAdapter for each possible event. The default callbacks do nothing. If you want to act upon events, you can customize the events' callbacks for your application in either of the following ways:

        • Provide an implementation of every callback method in the ToneDetectionListener interface with a class that implements ToneDetectionListener.
        • Provide an implementation of a subset of callback methods with a class that extends ToneDetectionAdapter.

        If multiple listeners are added to a device, then each listener will be notified of events on that device; the corresponding callback will be called on each listener that has been added.

        Parameters:
        device - the device to which the ToneDetectionListener is added.
        listener - the listener being applied to the device. The listener may be an implementation of the ToneDetectionListener interface or an extension of ToneDetectionAdapter.
        Throws:
        SystemResourceAvailabilityException - if a severe system error like un-availability of a system wide resource
        InvalidParameterValueException - if device ID or listener is null
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • removeToneDetectionListener

        void removeToneDetectionListener(DeviceID device,
                                 ToneDetectionListener listener)
                          throws CstaException
        Removes a previously specified tone detection listener. If the specified listener is not one that was previously added or no listener is on the device, then no exception is thrown and no function is performed.
        Parameters:
        device - the device whose ToneDetectionListener is to be removed
        listener - the listener being removed from the device.
        Throws:
        SystemResourceAvailabilityException - if a severe system error like un-availability of a system wide resource
        InvalidParameterValueException - if device ID is null or listener is null
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • addVoiceUnitListener

        void addVoiceUnitListener(DeviceID device,
                          VoiceUnitListener listener)
                   throws CstaException
        Adds a listener to monitor the specified physical device for voice unit events.

        Voice unit events report changes to the voice stream data messages being recorded and played. In other words, the voice unit events reflect the state changes of a Voice Unit.

        A Voice Unit state is a state that a Voice Unit may take in relating a call with a message. It relates a call to its message in terms of playing, recording, suspending, etc. Voice Units may have several states concurrently with respect to different calls and messages. Voice Unit states are reported by Voice Unit Event Reports. A typical transition model for Voice Unit states is shown in ECMA-269, section 6.2.1, "Voice Unit".

        Java listeners are used to implement the CSTA concept called monitoring. Adding a listener is equivalent to requesting a Monitor Start service.

        When an event occurs, the corresponding listener callback is called. A default callback is provided by VoiceUnitAdapter for each possible event. The default callbacks do nothing. If you want to act upon events, customize the events' callbacks for your application in either of the following ways:

        • Provide an implementation of every callback method in the VoiceUnitListener interface with a class that implements VoiceUnitListener.
        • Provide an implementation of a subset of callback methods with a class that extends VoiceUnitAdapter.

        If multiple listeners are added to a device, then each listener will be notified of events on that device; the corresponding callback will be called on each listener that has been added.

        When you no longer wish to receive Voice Unit events for the device, be sure to remove the Voice Unit listener(s) with removeVoiceUnitListener.

        Parameters:
        device - the device to which the VoiceUnitListener is applied
        listener - the listener being applied to the device. The listener may be an implementation of the VoiceUnitListener interface or an extension of VoiceUnitAdapter. If the specified listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterValueException - if an invalid parameter is passed
        SystemResourceAvailabilityException - if a severe system error like un-availability of a system wide resource
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • removeVoiceUnitListener

        void removeVoiceUnitListener(DeviceID device,
                             VoiceUnitListener listener)
                      throws CstaException
        Removes a previously specified voice unit listener. It is possible for a callback to be issued on a listener after it has been removed. If no listeners have been added, then nothing happens when an event occurs. This method performs no function, nor does it throw an exception if the specified listener was not previously added. If the specified listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
        Parameters:
        device - the device whose VoiceUnitListener is to be removed
        listener - the listener being removed from the device
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterValueException - if an invalid parameter is passed
        SystemResourceAvailabilityException - if a severe system error like un-availability of a system wide resource
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs
        See Also:
        addVoiceUnitListener(ch.ecma.csta.binding.DeviceID, ch.ecma.csta.voiceunit.VoiceUnitListener)

      • addRegistrationListener

        void addRegistrationListener(DeviceID device,
                             RegistrationListener listener)
                      throws CstaException
        Adds a RegistrationListener for receiving notification of unegistration events for a specific terminal. If multiple listeners are added, all listeners will be notified of events. For more information about using listeners see Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API.

        Registration events include:

        • TerminalUnregisteredEvent

        When your application no longer wants to be notified of unregistration events for a terminal, use the removeRegistrationListener(ch.ecma.csta.binding.DeviceID, com.avaya.csta.registration.RegistrationListener) for each listener that was added.

        Parameters:
        device - the DeviceID to register the listener for
        listener - the RegistrationListener implementation to add
        Throws:
        OperationException - if there is no station associated with the DeviceID. Check DeviceID or create DeviceID first.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the listener parameter is null
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • removeRegistrationListener

        void removeRegistrationListener(DeviceID device,
                                RegistrationListener listener)
                         throws CstaException
        Removes the specified RegistrationListener from receiving terminal unregistration events.
        Parameters:
        device - the DeviceID for which this RegistrationListener should be removed
        listener - the RegistrationListener to remove
        Throws:
        OperationException - if there is no station associated with the DeviceID. Cannot remove listener. Please check the DeviceID.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the listener parameter is null
        java.lang.Exception - if an implementation-specific exception occurs
        CstaException

        void addEndpointRegistrationStateListener(DeviceID device,
                                          EndpointRegistrationStateListener listener)
                                   throws CstaException
        Adds a EndpointRegistrationStateListener for receiving notification of registration and un-registration events for a specific endpoint.

        If multiple listeners are added, all listeners will be notified of events. For more information about using listeners see Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API.

        Endpoint registration state events include:

        • EndpointRegisteredEvent
        • EndpointUnregisteredEvent

        When your application no longer wants to be notified of registration and un-registration events for an endpoint, use the removeEndpointRegistrationStateListener(com.avaya.csta.registration.EndpointRegistrationStateListener) for each listener that was added.

        Parameters:
        device - the DeviceID to register the listener for
        listener - the EndpointRegistrationStateListener implementation to add
        Throws:
        OperationException - if there is no extension associated with the DeviceID. Check DeviceID or create DeviceID first.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the listener parameter is null
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • removeEndpointRegistrationStateListener

        void removeEndpointRegistrationStateListener(EndpointRegistrationStateListener listener)
                                      throws CstaException
        Removes the specified EndpointRegistrationStateListener from receiving terminal registration and un-registration events.

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        OperationException - if there is no extension associated with the DeviceID. Cannot remove listener. Please check the DeviceID.

        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • addCallControlListener

        void addCallControlListener(DeviceID device,
                            CallControlListener listener)
                     throws CstaException
        Adds a listener to monitor the specified call control events for a device. Events report changes to the components of the call status of the device (established, held, transferred and answered ....). To learn how to use listeners to monitor events, see Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API.
        Parameters:
        device - the DeviceID to which the CallControlListener is applied.
        listener - the CallControlListener being applied to the device. If the specified listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
        Throws:
        InvalidDeviceIDException - indicates that there is no station associated with the DeviceID
        ServiceNotSupportedException - indicates that the requested service is not supported
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs
        See Also:
        removeCallControlListener(ch.ecma.csta.binding.DeviceID, ch.ecma.csta.callcontrol.CallControlListener)

      • addCallControlListener

        void addCallControlListener(ConnectionID connectionId,
                            CallControlListener listener)
                     throws CstaException
        Supported in AES 6.1 and later.
        Adds a listener to monitor the specified call control events for a call. Events report changes to the components of the call (established, held, transferred and answered ....). To learn how to use listeners to monitor events, see Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API.

        The ConnectionID parameter, should be obtained from a previous response or event received in CallControlListener or by using snapshotDevice Obtaining the ConnectionID parameter this way ensures the DeviceID portion of the ConnectionID contains a Third Party Device ID, which is required to monitor an active call.

        Parameters:
        connectionId - the ConnectionID to which the CallControlListener is applied.
        listener - the CallControlListener being applied to the call. If the specified listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
        Throws:
        InvalidConnectionIDForActiveCallException - indicates that there is no call associated with the ConnectionID
        ResourceBusyException - indicates the service is busy adding a listener for the same device. Try again.
        SubscribedResourceAvailablityException - is thrown for any of the following conditions:
        • The device is not administered properly on the switch. Verify the IP Softphone field is enabled on the station form for the device
        • There is not a license available
        • The device is administered as a CTI station and the CTI Stations option is not enabled on the switch
        • The device is a station administered without hardware (AWOH) and the Phantom Calls option is not enabled on the switch
        • The device is a SIP Endpoint and the Third Party Call Control Type administered for the device is not set to Avaya
        ObjectMonitorLimitExceededException - indicates that the maximum number of monitors for the device has been met
        ServiceNotSupportedException - indicates that the requested service is not supported
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs
        See Also:
        removeCallControlListener(ch.ecma.csta.binding.DeviceID, ch.ecma.csta.callcontrol.CallControlListener)

      • addListenerForCallsViaDevice

        void addListenerForCallsViaDevice(DeviceID device,
                                  CallControlListener listener)
                           throws CstaException
        Supported in AES 6.1 and later.
        Adds a listener to monitor the specified call control events for all devices on all calls that involve the device. Event reports are provided for calls that arrive at the device after the listener is added. Events for calls that occurred prior are not reported. The DeviceID for this listener must be a VDN or ACD Split device, station devices must use addCallControlListener A listener cannot be added for a Vector-controlled ACD Split. A listener should instead be added to the VDN that provides access to the vector(s) that control the ACD Split. To learn how to use listeners to monitor events, see Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API.
        Parameters:
        device - the deviceID for the VDN or ACD Split to which the CallControlListener is applied.
        listener - the CallControlListener being applied to the device. If the specified listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
        Throws:
        InvalidDeviceIDException - indicates that there is no station associated with the DeviceID
        RequestIncompatibleWithObjectException - indicates the device is not administered correctly on the switch. The device is an adjunct-controlled ACD Split or a Vector-controlled ACD Split.
        ServiceNotSupportedException - indicates that the requested service is not supported
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs
        See Also:
        removeCallControlListener(ch.ecma.csta.binding.DeviceID, ch.ecma.csta.callcontrol.CallControlListener)

      • removeCallControlListener

        void removeCallControlListener(DeviceID device,
                               CallControlListener listener)
                        throws CstaException
        Removes a previously specified call control listener. It is possible for a callback to be issued on a listener after it has been removed.
        Parameters:
        device - the DeviceID whose CallControlListener is to be removed.
        listener - the CallControlListener being removed from the device. If the specified listener is not one that was previously added, then no exception is thrown and no function is performed. Also, if the specified listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
        Throws:
        InvalidDeviceIDException - indicates that there is no station associated with the DeviceID
        ServiceNotSupportedException - indicates that the requested service is not supported
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs
        See Also:
        addCallControlListener(ch.ecma.csta.binding.DeviceID, ch.ecma.csta.callcontrol.CallControlListener)

        listener - the CallControlListener being removed from the call. If the specified listener is not one that was previously added, then no exception is thrown and no function is performed. Also, if the specified listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
        Throws:

        See Also:
        addCallControlListener(ch.ecma.csta.binding.DeviceID, ch.ecma.csta.callcontrol.CallControlListener)

      • addDeviceServicesListener

        void addDeviceServicesListener(DeviceID device,
                               DeviceServicesListener listener)
                        throws CstaException
        Adds a listener to monitor the specified Device Services events. Events report changes to the components of the status of all the devices (getDeviceIdList, getMonitorList ....). To learn how to use listeners to monitor events, see Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API.
        Parameters:
        device - the DeviceID to which the DeviceServicesListener is applied.
        listener - the DeviceServicesListener being applied to the device. If the specified listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
        Throws:
        InvalidDeviceIDException - indicates that there is no station associated with the DeviceID
        ServiceNotSupportedException - indicates that the requested service is not supported
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs
        See Also:
        removeDeviceServicesListener(ch.ecma.csta.binding.DeviceID, com.avaya.csta.device.DeviceServicesListener)

      • removeDeviceServicesListener

        void removeDeviceServicesListener(DeviceID device,
                                  DeviceServicesListener listener)
                           throws CstaException
        Removes a previously specified Device Services listener. It is possible for a callback to be issued on a listener after it has been removed.
        Parameters:
        device - the DeviceID whose DeviceServicesListener is to be removed.
        listener - the DeviceServicesListener being removed from the device. If the specified listener is not one that was previously added, then no exception is thrown and no function is performed. Also, if the specified listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
        Throws:
        InvalidDeviceIDException - indicates that there is no station associated with the DeviceID
        ServiceNotSupportedException - indicates that the requested service is not supported
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs
        See Also:
        addDeviceServicesListener(ch.ecma.csta.binding.DeviceID, com.avaya.csta.device.DeviceServicesListener)
